main event: An unknown object with a reddish glow and blinking red lights was observed from a moving train near Lock, Nevada on May 13, 1954.
interesting points: The object was round in shape, about the size of a grapefruit, and had parallel sides about 3-4 inches thick.
The object exhibited unusual slow or negative trajectory, appearing and disappearing several times while returning to its original position.
The observation lasted for about 5 minutes, with the object appearing at 2235Z and disappearing at 2240Z.
The observer did not have sufficient time to obtain a compass reading or other detailed information about the object.
The weather was clear and calm at the time of the sighting.
sighted object: a round object with a reddish glow and blinking red lights
